intro: Gonocormus palmatus, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It is characterized by its woody stems and large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, orange, or yellow. The plant has palmate leaves that are divided into several lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. The flowers are not only ornamental but also attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
